Aidan Baker.title: Acoustic‚Äã/‚ÄãVariations On A Loop
Aidan Baker.about:
Four tracks constructed from four short (40-60 second) loops made with a 12-string acoustic guitar played in various different ways, as indicated in the track titles, and then played back and live-processed using multiple delay pedals. 



Released digitally by Hard Return, a label for repetitive / persistent music: 



hardreturn.bandcamp.com



 Other Aidan Baker releases in this 'Variations On A Loop' series can be found here: 



bspdigitalreleases.bandcamp.com

Aidan Baker.title: An Instance of Rising / Liminoid
Aidan Baker.about:
A limited CD release from Gizeh Records featuring two neo-classical pieces. "An Instance of RIsing" was commissioned by the Sacrum Profanum Festival in Krakow, Poland and performed on 30 September 2017 by Sp√≥≈Çdzielnia Muzyczna Contemporary Ensemble. 



"Liminoid," originally composed for 2008 performance at The Music Gallery in Toronto, Canada, was performed again at the Zemlika Festival in Durbe, Latvia on 28 October 2011 with members of the Sinfonietta Riga String Quartet + The Burning Kulba. 



www.gizehrecords.com

Aidan Baker.title: Already Drowning
Aidan Baker.about:

 Also available, a companion digital ep "Tout Juste Sous La Surface, Je Guette + Remixes" with mixes by Aidan Baker, A.R.C. Soundtracks, Schneider TM, & thisquietarmy:

Aidan Baker.title: The Spectrum of Distraction (Complete Sessions)
Aidan Baker.about:

aidanbaker.bandcamp.com/album/the-spectrum-of-distraction



 With contributions from 18 different drummers:



Aidan Baker, Richard Baker (ARC), Victor Cirone, Andrew Crawshaw (Shining Ones), Alessandro Curvaia (Shora), Bruno Dorella (Ovo), David Dunnett (Hypnodrone Ensemble), Thor Harris (Swans), Steven Hess (Locrian), Kevin Micka (Animal Hospital), Mac McNeilly (Jesus Lizard), Ted Parsons (Swans, Prong), Phil Petrocelli (Grey Machine, Great Falls), Simon Scott (Slowdive), Geoff Summers (Batillus), Jakob Thiesen (Whisper Room), Brandon Valdivia (I Have Eaten The City), H. Walker (Kerretta).



Artwork by Matt Smith: 



www.matt-illustrations.com

Aidan Baker.title: Concretion
Aidan Baker.about:
Three long tracks of experimental/ambient guitar and voice, originally released on cdr by DTA Records.



'T'was In The Moon of Wintertime' is also known as 'The Huron Carol'‚Äîor originally 'Jesous Ahatonhia' in the Wendat (Huron) language‚Äîand is purportedly Canada's oldest Christmas carol, and is not without controversy. Bruce Cockburn also recorded this carol and expressed, for anyone interested, some of his thoughts on that controversy here: 



cockburnproject.net/songs&music/ia.html

Aidan Baker.title: Triptychs: Variations On A Melody
Aidan Baker.about:
Triptychs: Variations On A Melody takes inspiration from Erik Satie's compositions Gymnop√©dies and his notion of "furniture music," which many consider a precursor to contemporary ambient music. Each "triptych" is based around a simple, slow-moving melodic line, which repeats three times with the addition of a harmonic line upon each repetition, culminating in a three part harmony. Available on CD from Important Records. 



www.importantrecords.com
Aidan Baker.credits:
released September 16, 2014
            
            Aidan Baker - guitars, melodica

Leah Buckareff - electric bass

David Nesselhauf - acoustic bass

Katie English - flute

Rose Bolton - violin

Peter Broderick - violin, piano

Angela Chan - viola

Julia Kent - cello

Felicia Atkinson - organ

Aki Yakamoto - piano

Aidan Baker.title: Letters
Aidan Baker.about: Two long tracks originally released in 2002 on cdr on Arcolepsy Records, reissued on vinyl by Basses Frequences in 2008, and tape by Music For Cassettes in 2019.
